provisions.content:

provisions.title: Section 2
provisions.content:
2. In this Act-
      "Campus" means all that land known as the Mona Campus of
           the University of the West Indies in the parish of Saint
           Andrew and comprised in Certificate of Title registered
           at Volume 703 Folio 75 of the Register Book of Titles;
2   [No. 37]   The University of The West Indies Security Act, 2002
         "Committee" means the Campus Finance and General
            Purposes Committee as established in the Charter of the
            University of the West Indies;
         "Corporate Area" has the same meaning as in the Judicature
             (Resident Magistrates) Act;
        "member of staff' means a person in the employment of the
           University engaged in teaching, research, administrative,
           professional, technical, clerical or ancillary duties;
        "parking place" means any portion of the Campus designated
             by the Committee as a place where a vehicle may be
            parked;
       "restricted area" means any part of the Campus so designated
             by the University;
       "security officer" means-
                 (a)   a member of staff who performs security
                       duties;
                (b) a person assigned to the Campus to perform
                    security duties by the security company to
                    which he is employed, being a company
                    contracted by the Committee to carry out
                    security services on the Campus; or
                (c)    a member of the Jamaica Constabulary Force,
                       the Island Special Constabulary Force or the
                       Jamaica Defence Force;
     "Senate" means the Senate of the University of the West
         Indies;
     "student" means a person who is registered as a student of the
          University (whether full-time or part-time) during a
          current year for a first or higher degree, diploma,
          certificate or such other qualification or courses of the
          University as may be approved by the Senate;
           The University of The West Indies Security Act, 2002   [No. 37]                3
      "traffic sign" means any sign or other device for the guidance
            or direction of persons using the roadways on the
            Campus, which the University causes or permits to be
           placed on or near any such roadway and includes a-
                ( a) speed limit sign;
                (b) mark on the surface of a roadway;
                (c) signal, whether automatic, electrical or
                    otherwise;
                ( d) warning sign post; and
               (e) direction post;
     "Tribunal" means the Tribunal established under section 17;
     "University" means the University of the West Indies
         established by Royal Charter;
     "vehicle" means a wheeled vehicle whether mechanically
          propelled or not, intended and adapted for use on a road,
          and includes a truck, motor car, motor cycle, pedal cycle,
          tractor, mower and push cart.

provisions.title: Section 10
provisions.content:
10. Nothing in this Act shall prevent the driver of a vehicle, in
                   response to an emergency involving danger to life or property,
                   from operating that vehicle on the Campus in a manner necessitated
                   by that emergency.
 Erection of          11. (1) The person with responsibility for security shall, after
 traffic signs.
etc.               consultation with the Committee, cause to be placed, erected or
                   displayed on the Campus, such traffic signs as are considered
                   necessary for the proper direction, control and regulation of
                   vehicular traffic thereon.
                          (2) Any person operating a vehicle on the Campus shall
                   comply with the traffic signs thereon.
                           (3) A pedestrian who is on the Campus, shall within a
                  pedestrian lane marking, have the right of way over vehicular traffic.
                          (4) A person shall not load or unload goods unto or from
                  any vehicle on the Campus except at such place as may be
                  designated for that purpose.
Parting place.       12.-(1) The Committee shall designate any area of the Campus
                  as it thinks fit as a parking place.
                          (2) Any person who parks a vehicle within the boundaries
                  of the Campus shall do so within a parking place.
                           (3) Subsection (4) shall apply to any vehicle that is parked
                  in an area of the Campus where that vehicle endangers the life or
                  safety of any person or obstructs a fire hydrant or a parking place
                  reserved for disabled persons.
                          ( 4) A vehicle which is not parked in the manner described
                  in subsection (2) shall be clamped or towed away at the owner's
                  expense, and shall be released only on payment of a fine of three
                  thousand dollars to the Committee.
                         (5) The amount of the fine imposed under subsection (4)
                  may be increased by regulations made under section 16.

Section 14
provisions.content:
14. -(1) Any person who is on the Campus is liable to have his Search.
person. motor vehicle, bag or other container searched by a
constable, if that constable has reasonable grounds to believe that
the person has in his possession any property which is being
illegally removed from the Campus.
          (2) The constable conducting the search sha11 take such
steps as are reasonably practicable in the circumstances to ensure
that the person being searched is afforded every opportunity to
observe everything done in relation to the search.
           (3) Subject to subsection (+), a female shall only be
 searched by another female.
            (4) Where there is reasonable cause for the conduct of a
 search of a body cavity, that search shall only be conducted by a
 registered medical practitioner.

provisions.title: Section 15
provisions.content:
15.-(1) There is hereby established a Tribunal for the purposes Tribunal.
  of hearing appeals under this Act and the provisions of the Schedule Schedule.
  shall have effect as to the constitution of the Tribunal and otherwise
  in relation thereto.
             (2) A person who is aggrieved by a decision of the
  Committee under section 3, 4, 5 or 8 may appeal to the Tribunal in
  the prescribed manner.
           (3) Subject to the provisions of this section, the Tribunal
   may, in respect of any such appeal, quash or vary the decision OE
   may dismiss the appeal.
            (4) If the decision is varied or the appeal is dismissed, the
   Tribunal may direct that the decision of the Committee shall not
 8               [No. 37)      The University of The West Indies Security Act, 2002
                 take effect until such date (not being later than twenty-eight days
                 from the determination of the appeal) as the Tribunal thinks fit.
                         (5) Before determining an appeal the Tribunal shall give
                 the appellant, who may be represented by an attorney-at-law or
                 any other person, the opportunity to be heard by the Tribunal.
 Regulations.      16. The Minister may, after consultation with the Committee,
                 make regulations generally for the better carrying out of the
                 purposes of this Act.
 oni:nces.          17. A person who contravenes section 3,4,5,6,7,8,9 or 13
                 commits an offence and shall be liable on summary conviction
                 before a Resident Magistrate to a fine not exceeding two hundred
                 thousand dollars.
